result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use or Possess w/ Intent to Use Masking Agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J. Dalton

defendant.name: Dalton, Jesse J.
defendant.address: 1300 Lange Court, c/o Sauk County Jail, Baraboo, WI 53913

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:46 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jesse J. Dalton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taavi Mc Mahon appeared by video for Jesse J. Dalton.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney McMahon is heard. 
Court will reschedule hearing for a motion hearing via zoom for case 21CF02 and a status for the other two cases 21CF35 and 21CF35.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Atty. Taavi McMahon
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 09:45 am. (Note change in time - (was orig. scheduled for 11:30AM and rescheduled to accommodate Sauk Co jail schedule)
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:01 AM Case called - appearances stated. Cases 21CF02, 21CF35 & 22CF84 called together
Defendant Jesse J. Dalton appeared by audio, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court advises that def does qualify for Public Defender, but they have been unable to find an attorney
Def. state this has been going on 90 days, requests speedy trial. Asserts his 6th amendment right

Court will continue one more time - if Public defender does not have an attorney appointed by next hearing, court will appoint a court appointed attorney
Defendant renews his request for a speedy trial

Court advises the defendant to notify the Public Defenders office again and express his frustration with the lack of attorney.  If they do not have one by the next hearing, court will appoint an attorney at county expense
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:16 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jesse J. Dalton appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

21CF02, 21CF35 and 22CF84 called together.  

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an attorney.  

22CF84 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count. Defendant states understanding.
Status hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Per Public Defender, he DOES QUALIFY for P.D. representation, but they will not have an atty. available for today's hrg.  nad
TC with Sauk County Jail - request to move 11:30 AM hearings as they are during lunch/lock down times.  JA approved and moved to 1:15 PM on 8/22/22.  Zoom arrangements confirmed.
Jury status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prior: c/o Sauk County Jail, 1300 Lange Court, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse J. Dalton
Current: c/o Sauk County Jail, 1300 Lange Court, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 07-26-2022)
Prior: 1505 East Wells Street #108, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821
Jury status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:45 AM Cases 21CF02, 21CF35 & 22CF84 called together- appearances stated. 
Defendant Jesse J. Dalton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court advises that Def. does qualify for Public Def. but they were unable to have attorney available today
Def. requests a court appointed attorney
Court will not appoint a court appointed attorney when he qualifies for public defender. 
questions by Def. re: Atty Kieler's representation - court advises that Atty. filed a motion to withdraw and that was granted.  If def. feels some part of his retainer is left he should take it up with Atty. Kieler
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Per Public Defender, Def DOES QUALIFY for pub. def., but they will not have one available on 07/27.  Jesse wants to keep the hrg. on the calendar anyway.  nad
Jury status hearing on July 27, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:01 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jesse J. Dalton appeared by video, in custody in Sauk County Jail.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Jesse J. Dalton. 

2021CF000002, 2021CF000035, 2022CF000084 called

Attorney Kieler is heard on the status of the case.  Attorney Kieler states withdraw. 
Defendant is heard. 
Attorney Kieler states that defendant qualifies a public defender. 
Defendant is heard. 
Court gives defendant public defender office phone.  
Court grants withdraw request for Attorney Ryan Kieler.  
Arrangements to be made with the Sauk County Jail for the defendant to appear for the next hearing.
Jury status hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Bail/bond hearing on May 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:04 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jesse James Dalton appeared by video, in custody in the Crawford County Jail.  Attorney Steiner appeared via video for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kieler appeared for the defendant via video. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $1,500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Atty Kieler is heard on bond. Requests a signature bond.

Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
